page.title: 06ITEMS OF INTEREST
page.content: The Gawsworth Cross. The cross stands by the junction of Wood House lane and Church lane on a small triangle of land.In early spring daffodils and crocus grow.The cross stands there in memory of the soldiers who died in the War of 1914-1919 the cross says"The souls of the Righteous are in the hands of God and there shall be no torment touch them".On the top of the it says"I.N.R.I."which stands for Iesus Nazarenus Rex Iudaeorum which means Jesus of Nazareth King of the Jews. The cross also commemorates," John Nixon, Fredrick Ridgeway,Arthur Swindells,William Torkington,Fred Trueman who died in the war of 1939-1945." Written by Andrew Scholes.
